channel.title: Windows 10
channel.description:
http://blogs.windows.com/bloggingwindows/2014/09/30/announcing-windows-10/
Tomorrow will see the release of the technical preview of Windows 10!

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

I’ll probably grab this and play with it over the weekend. I’m personally looking forward to it - Microsoft have really lifted their game over the last few years. Even though Windows 8 has its drawbacks (primarily compelling desktop users to work within a mobile-device paradigm) it’s still a solid product. I expect Windows 10 will be even more so.

Also, I’m looking forward to ASP.NET vNext, the next Visual Studio, and so on. It’s going to kick arse.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:40, topic:547027”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=665926.msg4452913#msg4452913 date=1412779572]

Some screenshots here: https://imgur.com/a/rlBlT#0

Is that the Chrome app or desktop version? Or does it matter, I noticed that non-fullscreen apps were a new edition.
[/quote]
Chrome doesn’t actually have an app version. Their store page just directs you to Google’s website.

You can freely switch between the two modes at any time though
[/quote]
Well, in a way, “Windows 8 mode” runs chrome as an “app”, which I what I mean instead.

Read full topic

[/quote]
Is that the Chrome app or desktop version? Or does it matter, I noticed that non-fullscreen apps were a new edition.[/quote]
Chrome doesn’t actually have an app version. Their store page just directs you to Google’s website.

You can freely switch between the two modes at any time though

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:35, topic:547027”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=665926.msg4452807#msg4452807 date=1412707371]

[quote author=Travas link=topic=665926.msg4452725#msg4452725 date=1412642412]

[quote author=Pure_ link=topic=665926.msg4452700#msg4452700 date=1412632738]

Just installed, it’s a lot better than 8/8.1
[/quote]Any specifics? Preferably something technical and not aesthetic.
[/quote]Apps no longer open full-screen, which makes multitasking a lot easier. Charm bar is gone from what I’ve noticed as well, so your power options are right next to your account name and picture on the start menu, which is a perfect place for it. Searching is a ton easier now as well. The operating system seems like it’s built for desktops this time, rather than touch screen devices such as tablets. All in all, not bad imo. I haven’t really got to take a good look at it since I’m away from my desktop 6 days out of the week and don’t want to install it on my Surface Pro 3.

I’d actually recommend upgrading to Windows 10 when it’s fully released. Seems really spot on unlike when Windows 8 first came out.

Think you could take some screens next chance you get?
[/quote]Next time I’m on my desktop is Friday. Anything specific you want a screenshots of?[/quote]
Primarily the items you described as helpful changes

jediz:

Some screenshots here: https://imgur.com/a/rlBlT#0

Is that the Chrome app or desktop version? Or does it matter, I noticed that non-fullscreen apps were a new edition.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

I only used Windows 8 sparingly but from what I’ve seen of Windows 10 it has been a pretty major upgrade. Think Vista to 7… 8 was the shitty unpolished version and 10 is the fixed version that should have been released in the first place.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:34, topic:547027”][quote author=Travas link=topic=665926.msg4452725#msg4452725 date=1412642412]

[quote author=Pure_ link=topic=665926.msg4452700#msg4452700 date=1412632738]

Just installed, it’s a lot better than 8/8.1
[/quote]Any specifics? Preferably something technical and not aesthetic.
[/quote]Apps no longer open full-screen, which makes multitasking a lot easier. Charm bar is gone from what I’ve noticed as well, so your power options are right next to your account name and picture on the start menu, which is a perfect place for it. Searching is a ton easier now as well. The operating system seems like it’s built for desktops this time, rather than touch screen devices such as tablets. All in all, not bad imo. I haven’t really got to take a good look at it since I’m away from my desktop 6 days out of the week and don’t want to install it on my Surface Pro 3.

I’d actually recommend upgrading to Windows 10 when it’s fully released. Seems really spot on unlike when Windows 8 first came out.

Think you could take some screens next chance you get?[/quote]Next time I’m on my desktop is Friday. Anything specific you want a screenshots of?

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:33, topic:547027”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=665926.msg4452700#msg4452700 date=1412632738]

[quote author=Travas link=topic=665926.msg4452585#msg4452585 date=1412554904]
Just installed, it’s a lot better than 8/8.1
[/quote]Any specifics? Preferably something technical and not aesthetic.
[/quote]Apps no longer open full-screen, which makes multitasking a lot easier. Charm bar is gone from what I’ve noticed as well, so your power options are right next to your account name and picture on the start menu, which is a perfect place for it. Searching is a ton easier now as well. The operating system seems like it’s built for desktops this time, rather than touch screen devices such as tablets. All in all, not bad imo. I haven’t really got to take a good look at it since I’m away from my desktop 6 days out of the week and don’t want to install it on my Surface Pro 3.

I’d actually recommend upgrading to Windows 10 when it’s fully released. Seems really spot on unlike when Windows 8 first came out.[/quote]
Think you could take some screens next chance you get?

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:32, topic:547027”][quote author=Travas link=topic=665926.msg4452585#msg4452585 date=1412554904]
Just installed, it’s a lot better than 8/8.1
[/quote]Any specifics? Preferably something technical and not aesthetic.[/quote]Apps no longer open full-screen, which makes multitasking a lot easier. Charm bar is gone from what I’ve noticed as well, so your power options are right next to your account name and picture on the start menu, which is a perfect place for it. Searching is a ton easier now as well. The operating system seems like it’s built for desktops this time, rather than touch screen devices such as tablets. All in all, not bad imo. I haven’t really got to take a good look at it since I’m away from my desktop 6 days out of the week and don’t want to install it on my Surface Pro 3.

I’d actually recommend upgrading to Windows 10 when it’s fully released. Seems really spot on unlike when Windows 8 first came out.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

[quote=“Elrick, post:27, topic:547027”][quote author=Lil_Smok3r link=topic=665926.msg4452256#msg4452256 date=1412370126]
Windows 10 is already coming out and i’m still on Windows 7
[/quote]
I never understood why someone would bother upgrading. Unless a newer version has something that completely revamps the way computers work, the cost is too much to be bothered with. Besides, 8 sucked and they had to go to 8.1, and 9 interferes with 95 and 98, so the gap really isn’t that big. And Windows 7 works like a charm, at least for the extent to which I have to use it.[/quote]

Just sign up for a year of membership at microsoft for 300$ average i think, and you get every windows available with download and Regiatration keys.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:

Lil_Smok3r:

Windows 10 is already coming out and i’m still on Windows 7

I never understood why someone would bother upgrading. Unless a newer version has something that completely revamps the way computers work, the cost is too much to be bothered with. Besides, 8 sucked and they had to go to 8.1, and 9 interferes with 95 and 98, so the gap really isn’t that big. And Windows 7 works like a charm, at least for the extent to which I have to use it.

item.title: Windows 10
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“lesterknome, post:19, topic:547027”]I liked what I saw except that social media feed in the start menu. They just need to let that idea go, its what smart phones are for.

Yeah, but you know what’s better? Your lack of independence.

mean.[/quote]
The start menu can be resized, and in a few of the images I’ve seen you can make it skinny enough that all of the live tiles are hidden completely.

Read full topic
